message: @ericflow
No chat spam
no piss taking of presenters accents
and the group/topic set up makes it real focused
How many moderators have been on Convore during Launch?
o/
Looks pretty close to me. :)
@leah I really like Convore in a setting like Launch, where there's an active dialogue.  Is that the use case you had in mind?  Do you think longer-term communities will pop up?
Yes, totally need that
Oh, I *really* wish I could tab-complete people's names in the input box
oh I can...I keep doing that...you guys already thought of everything :-)
(I swear I tried and couldn't!)
however, there are some other types of groups too
I thought it was great!
no name calling
*is
It does but now its been pointed out it does look....wrong?
@leah glad I did
just great discussion
I wish we would have used it for Startup Riot in Atlanta last week
Yeah, recent topic bubbling was great.  If I left the conference for a bit, when I came back I didn't miss a beat.
Convore seems to be useful both in the moment and after the fact, and some validation of the identity of users seems to reduce the jerk factor
And it will still be here for further discussion later
I will say that a trend I've seen and dislike is people dropping links to their new group into other group discussions.
But usage patterns are still emergent, so who knows how big of an issue that it?

My main concern was whether or not I could easily revisit and catch up with topics.  It seems to be effortless to do so with time periods around an hour, but I'll have to see what it's like after a 2-3 day hiatus.
@travhimself, it also seems like the application easily scales with the "liveness" of a topic.
Loved it.  It's got the "liveness" of IRC but I can leave without fear of missing something since I can always revisit the unread messages.
\o
Interesting.  Mahalo devs use IRC during the day -- I wonder how if Convore could fill that role for us.
Great job @leah and @ericflow!
Eh.  I think it's fine.  :)  Nitpicky stuff.  As a UI guy I know how tough it can be tough to reconcile those 1px differences between browsers.
not a language guy are ya
gah, double fail:   @ericflo
Thanks guys!
but should reduce trolling
@jake_gold you could make a private group if you'd like to say things that you don't want on google :P
Here, just poke around this site http://www.dack.com/web/bullshit.html
It's really well done. I love the sub-topics. I wish the thumbnail next to the text input box lined up with it.
well if you think of each topic as a "thread" then its a lot like a forum
@travhimself I agree that it's good for conferences and I think that's the obvious use case
@leah I think you should add rel="nofollow" to links so there's no incentive to spam
XSS..
ouch
yeah he allowed everything
OCDing on it
oh maybe it does but I zoomed? dunno
My co-founder summed it up as a "live forum" which I think is actually a much better description than a chat room
@jake_gold we're still trying to figure out the best way to describe it
i explained it to someone the other day as "a better forum"
Hacker News, that is.
@travhimself Definitely! I'm not a UI guy but I can appreciate Convor's UI is real good, especially for a product this new.
it's kind of frustrating because we'd love to tell people just to try it
@jake_gold good suggestion
The pen.io guy got hacked in 5 minutes on HN ;-)
It's definitely great UX
I love the URL structure... /launch/shoefiter
I heard someone voice a desire for a count or list of users currently in a topic
@jake_gold yeah, i like that description
It's like chat with meta data.
it's a bit spooky that your comments are frozen forever and visible in Google
@leah One by one
this one is pretty active: https://convore.com/django-community/
and a lot of private groups are company work groups
probably would work well for pen.io too :P
This is the a great next generation forum. Clean, easy, and better than the others. Good job @leah and @ericflo

@leah @ericflo I was part of the live discussion for part of Launch day 1 and just watched 2 sessions of Thursday's Launch. Live it feels like 'civilized chat'- because the comments will be there forever, I'm much less likely to cross the line (the jokes that go a little too far). In the follow up, where I commented after the fact while watching the video I missed having other people around, but I was motivated to leave useful information for people who come into the convore later on. My one suggestion would be that a user's comments get aggregated into a single pane somewhere in their account. Not for everyone to see but for the user. At some point you might consider making anonymous Convores an option, for fun, but perhaps with a built in destruct mechanism. I love your app and think it's the freshest thing I've seen in a long time.

It was ok, but only because of the initial people on the chat.

Once it gets adopted by the wider public, as a tool though Comvore is ok.... but not like the wheel got re-invented. Like Hot Potato the issues will always be scaling.

Of course making money apart will always be the issue - though i have no doubt half a dozen angels will throw money at it....though thats not the same thing as making revenues now is it :P
